articles.description: England retaining their European crown proves they are not just a one hit wonder and solidifies their legacy in women's sport.
articles.title: Euro 2025: England's second consecutive European triumph solidifies legacy

articles.description: Manchester City are set to pay £27m to buy back goalkeeper James Trafford from Burnley.
articles.title: James Trafford: Manchester City agree £27m deal to re-sign keeper

articles.description: Showboating Kyren Wilson spurns the chance to make history when he attempted a no-look shot on the black in his 6-5 victory over Si Jiahui at the Shanghai Masters.
articles.title: Shanghai Masters: Kyren Wilson misses out on history after no-look black

articles.description: Germany's double Olympic biathlon champion Laura Dahlmeier is "seriously injured" in a severe mountaineering accident in Pakistan.
articles.title: Laura Dahlmeier: Olympic star injured in climbing accident

articles.description: In leading his team to a series win in Australia, Lions captain Maro Itoje is congratulated by the legendary Willie John McBride.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions 2025: Maro Itoje joins the list of Lions legends

articles.description: BBC Sport takes a look at how Liverpool could fit both Hugo Ekitike and Alexander Isak in the same team.
articles.title: Liverpool: How Hugo Ekitike and Alexander Isak could fit in the team

articles.description: Everton boss David Moyes says the club are "running out" of time to make the impact they were hoping for in the summer transfer window.
articles.title: Everton: David Moyes says club running out of time to sign players

articles.description: British swimmer Adam Peaty is targeting four gold medals at the Los Angeles Olympics in 2028.
articles.title: Adam Peaty targets four gold medals at 2028 Olympics

articles.description: Video footage emerges on social media of a confrontation between India head coach Gautam Gambhir and Surrey's head of ground staff, Lee Fortis.
articles.title: England v India: Gautam Gambhir involved in confrontation with Surrey ground staff over Test pitch

articles.description: Four people were killed when a gunman stormed a skyscraper on Monday evening and opened fire.
articles.title: New York gunman left note blaming NFL for brain injury, mayor says
